personal.Name: Nashib
personal.title: 2nd Year Bachelor of IT Student
personal.residency_status: International student residing in Australia for over 1 year (since 2024)
personal.cultural_background: Nepalese background with strong adaptation to Australian professional culture
personal.summary: My name is Nashib Rana Magar. I'm a 20-year-old motivated 2nd year IT student of Nepalese background, residing in Sydney, Australia. Passionate about software development and problem-solving with over a year of experience adapting to Australian academic and professional environments. Building expertise in Java, Python, PHP, and SQL while seeking internship opportunities to apply classroom knowledge to real-world projects.
personal.elevator_pitch: Hi, I'm Nashib, a Nepalese student pursuing my 2nd year in IT at Victoria University in Sydney. My full name is Nashib Rana Magar. I've been living in Australia for over a year, gaining valuable cross-cultural experience while building my technical skills. I'm passionate about creating software solutions and have hands-on experience with Java, Python, PHP, and SQL through academic projects and personal learning. I bring both technical expertise and a unique international perspective, and I'm eager to contribute to meaningful projects in a professional environment while continuing to grow as a developer.

salary_location.salary_expectations: $30-35/hour for internship or $50,000-60,000 AUD for graduate role
salary_location.remote_experience: Completed group projects remotely using Git, Slack, and Zoom
salary_location.travel_availability: Flexible, can accommodate reasonable travel requirements
salary_location.work_authorization: International student from Nepal on Student Visa (subclass 500) - 48 hours/fortnight work rights during semester, unlimited during breaks. Residing in Australia since 2024 (over 1 year)

visa_details.work_limitations: 48 hours per fortnight during semester, unlimited hours during university breaks
visa_details.eligibility_notes: Eligible for casual, part-time internships and graduate programs that accept international students

experience.context: Team project for Web Development course - 2-person team
experience.team_structure: 2-person collaborative team, shared development and design responsibilities

achievements_star.situation: Required to build a functional web application for managing library books with an engaging, themed user interface
achievements_star.task: Design and develop a full-stack library management system with Hogwarts theme, including book catalog, borrowing system, and user management
achievements_star.action: Developed using PHP for backend logic, MySQL for database management, and HTML/CSS/JavaScript for the Hogwarts-themed frontend. Implemented CRUD operations for books, member registration, borrowing/returning functionality, and search features. Designed database schema with proper relationships between books, members, and transactions
achievements_star.result: Successfully delivered a fully functional library system with immersive Hogwarts theme. Achieved HD grade, demonstrated strong teamwork and technical skills. Application handled 500+ book records and 100+ user accounts efficiently

achievements_star.situation: Working with a partner required effective collaboration and code integration
achievements_star.task: Coordinate development tasks and maintain code quality
achievements_star.action: Used Git for version control, divided work into frontend/backend modules, conducted peer code reviews, and maintained clear communication via regular meetings
achievements_star.result: Seamless collaboration with zero major conflicts, both team members contributed equally, delivered project ahead of deadline

key_features: Book catalog with search and filter functionality
Borrowing and returning system with due date tracking
Hogwarts house-themed UI with custom styling
leadership_examples: Coordinated task distribution with team partner
Conducted code reviews and quality checks

experience.project_name: Cyber Security Lab - Network Security & Threat Detection
experience.context: Individual project for Cyber Security course
experience.team_structure: Hands-on lab project focusing on network security and intrusion detection

achievements_star.situation: Needed to understand cyber attack vectors and implement security measures to protect virtual infrastructure
achievements_star.task: Set up virtual machines, simulate various cyber attacks, and implement security tools to detect and prevent intrusions
achievements_star.action: Created virtual lab environment using VirtualBox/VMware. Configured multiple VMs to simulate attacker and target machines. Simulated attacks including port scanning, brute force, DDoS, and malware injection. Implemented Wazuh (SIEM/XDR platform) for security monitoring, log analysis, and threat detection. Deployed Snort (IDS/IPS) to detect and prevent network intrusions. Configured security rules, analyzed attack patterns, and documented incident response procedures
achievements_star.result: Successfully detected and mitigated 95% of simulated attacks. Gained hands-on experience with enterprise security tools. Received HD grade for comprehensive security implementation and detailed incident reports. Developed strong understanding of security operations and threat hunting

achievements_star.situation: Complex security tools required extensive learning and troubleshooting
achievements_star.task: Master Wazuh and Snort configurations within limited timeframe
achievements_star.action: Studied official documentation, followed tutorials, participated in online security communities, and conducted multiple test scenarios to understand tool capabilities
achievements_star.result: Successfully configured both tools, created custom detection rules, and demonstrated proficiency in security monitoring and incident response

security_concepts_learned: Common attack vectors and mitigation strategies

behavioral: Tell me about yourself and why you're studying IT
Why are you interested in this internship/role?
Describe a challenging project you worked on and how you overcame difficulties
Tell me about a time you worked in a team. What was your role?
How do you manage your time between studying and other commitments?
What's your biggest achievement in your studies so far?
Describe a situation where you had to learn something new quickly
How do you handle constructive criticism or feedback?
technical: Explain the difference between Java and Python
What is Object-Oriented Programming? Can you give examples?
What's the difference between GET and POST in HTTP?
How would you design a simple database for a library system?
What are some common data structures you've learned? When would you use each?
What's your process for debugging code?
Walk me through one of your projects from your GitHub
coding_challenges: Write a function to reverse a string
Write SQL queries to retrieve specific data
Create a basic CRUD API endpoint
situational: You're given a task you don't know how to complete. What do you do?
How would you approach learning a new programming language or framework?
If you're stuck on a bug for hours, what would you do?
How would you prioritize multiple assignments with tight deadlines?
What would you do if you disagreed with a team member's approach?

preparation_questions: What excites you about our company?
What do you know about what we do?
Why do you want to work here?
What questions do you have for us?
What can you contribute to our team?
questions_to_ask: What does a typical day look like for an intern/junior developer?
What kind of projects would I be working on?
What technologies does the team use?
What opportunities are there for learning and growth?
What's the team structure and who would I be working with?
